org.accada.reader.rprm.core.msg
Class IncomingMessageBuffer

java.lang.Object
  org.accada.reader.rprm.core.msg.IncomingMessageBuffer
All Implemented Interfaces:
IncomingMessageListener
public class IncomingMessageBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
implements IncomingMessageListener

IncomingMessageBuffer is a buffer that stores IncomingMessage It is added to each client connection as a listener, so that it can be notified if there is a new message.

Author:
Dijana Micijevic, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2003/04, Andreas Fürer, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2005/06

put

public void put(java.lang.Object element)
Adds an element to the end of this buffer.

Parameters:
element - the element to be added

get

public java.lang.Object get()
Removes the first element from the buffer. If the buffer is empty, the calling thread will be blocked until another thread adds an element to the buffer.

Returns:
the first element in the buffer

clean

public void clean()
Cleans the buffer

messageReceived

public void messageReceived(IncomingMessage msg)
Description copied from interface: IncomingMessageListener
This method is called by Connection to notify a listener that there is a new message. It puts a message into the buffer.

Specified by:
messageReceived in interface IncomingMessageListener
Parameters:
msg - new message
